characters: BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAE is naked. Wrapped around her shoulders is a loose-knit spread that  conceals her slender form. She is in her 20's: a strawber blond, with cinnamon freckles spotted across her pale ski She is beautiful without trying. She stares at the distant trees. This is the South; the s town of FISHERVILLE, TENNESSEE. Soon Rae will be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RONNIE is 25 years old. His hair is cropped in a military issue buzz. Rae's face is wet with tears as Ronnie gently makes love her. She touches his face and sobs like a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RONNIE is dressed in his National Guard fatigues, packing his gear. Rae is now wearing a short jeans skirt and a T-shirt with gray wolf print ironed on the front. There is a knock at door. Rae flinches. Ronnie opens the door revealing GILL  MORTON, Ronnie's buddy from high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still need a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Transmission's shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill and Rae's eyes meet. Gill sees that Rae is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna have a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie shuts the door and feels a wave of sudden nausea. rushes past Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is vomiting into the toilet as Rae rubs his head.  Each painful dry heave makes Rae comfort him more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie places his duffle bag in Gill's truck. Rae begins cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae doesn't answer. Gill backs away, allowing Ronnie and Rae some privacy. Th two lovers stare into each others eyes and then embrace. Rae peeks over Ronnie's shoulder at Gill with an expressi of dread. Anger seizes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see why we gotta lie 'bout  it when you and I know this ain't  gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds her face in  his hands) Rae don't do this now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stupid... It's so fucking stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Rae melts. Tears stream down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches in his pocket) Look it. I got somethin' for us.  This is gonna help, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna miss your bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie removes a small digital watch and fastens it aroun her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This watch here is gonna beep at  midnight. Every night. That's when  it comes up on you the hardest, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie holds out his own wrist to show her his identical  watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And wherever I'm at, my watch'll  beep, too. We'll be thinkin' bout  each other at the same time. Wherever  we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is shaking. He grips her by the back of her neck and  pushes their faces inches away. Eye to eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta believe we can do this or I  ain't gonna make it, Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae sees the fear in his eyes. She swallows her own anxie and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid of his swelling emotion, Ronnie quickly breaks awa from her. Rae watches as her love leaves in Gill's pick-up. Compell to follow, she absently walks after the truck, down the g drive. She stops. Silence. She is alone. An intense wave of sorrow hits, like a kick to her gut. S gasps for breath as she struggles to hold back the flood her tears. Rae drops to her knees, right there in the gravel drive. hair falls in front of her face, masking her grief. Her shoulders shudder. Her middle finger begins to scratch at her thigh repeated a nervous habit that has always accompanied this burning  sensation that consumes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears come to her. She's not going to be able to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Ronnie... (shouting in  frustration) GODDAMMIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is gripping the watch around her wrist for comfort. H breathing is already out of her control. The dizziness is already upon her. The familiar burning. She inhales in gasps, rocking back and forth on her knees The late morning cicadas chirp in an undulating frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Mm-mm (meaning "no") Mm-mm... Mm-mm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scratching at her leg leaves a red mark. She is dizzy with anxiety. Her teeth are clenched, her face is flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MM-MM! MM-MM! MMMMMMMMMMMM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEHRONNE is fucking Rae from behind. Tehronne is a muscular, dark-skinned, black male in his l twenties. Rae's face is crammed up against the mirror in the small  bathroom. Tehronne gets faster and pushes harder -- a sta contrast to her lovemaking with Ronnie. Rae comes. A severe coughing fit hits her. She pushes him away with her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking with his hands shoved deep into his pockets, wear his only suit and tie, is LAZARUS WOODS (LAZ). He is in h late fifties, black, a strong face under his old fedora. stares across the street into Dunn's Cafe. ROSE WOODS, black, early forties, stands in the cafe. She looks confident and resolute in her new green skirt. A brown Delta Olds pulls up into a parking space in front Laz. Stepping out is REVEREND R.L., Laz's longtime friend He is also black and in his late fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna make a fuss, are  you? (no answer) Nothing a man can do when a woman  make up her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never laid a hand on her in anger.  Not a day. Not even when I's drinkin'.  But this business got me wonderin'  what a good shake and slap would do  for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kind of talk is between us.  Don't you go in there with that shit  on your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't start this, R.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz tries to stop his lip from quivering: the man is hurt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna pray with me 'fore you go  in? Laz? (R.L. touches Laz's  arm and bows his  head) Heavenly Father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L.'s prayer is heard as Laz opens the front door to the cafe. He looks ill. Each step is painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do not question your divine plan  for us, Oh God. But in these times,  when our spirit lies in shadow. When  we are lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz crosses to Rose's booth -- the distance seems to stre out into eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ask that you give us strength.  Give us strength that surpasses all  understanding. In your name we pray.  Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz sits across from his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't remember the last time I saw  you in that suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother's funeral. I's a  pallbearer, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress is kind and twangy as she asks for their ord

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I start you both off with some  coffee 'fore I take your order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't be stayin' long. Coffee'll  be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress leaves. The sounds of the cafe fill the sile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We leavin' this weekend. Deke got a  friend in Mobile gonna get him a job  at the water company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) If you come to talk about that  muthafucka, I'm gonna get up and  leave you sittin' pretty in that new  suit he bought'cha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think this about money still, ya old  fool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what you gotta say, but I ain't  gonna hear you speak his name to me.  Not never. You hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times we been over this,  Laz? How many times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress places the coffee between them and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought we was gonna be friendly  about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carryin' on behind my back. Make me  out to look like a fool to all our  people. Tell me, what's friendly  about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready to grow old, Laz. Livin'  with you. I feel it. Like I'm one  foot in the dirt. Saw it happen to  my momma. And that's not gonna happen  to me. I got living to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you gonna live it with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose doesn't answer. Lazarus softens, touching her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose. Folks get sick. But you do  what you can to get on the mend. Our  marriage... it just got sick. That's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me about sick. Ain't been  right since I moved into that drafty  house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep the heat on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That damned, rusty, radiator, bout  burned the skin off my legs each  time I passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kept us warm for twelve years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. Laz has lost her for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserve better than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better'n me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than what you give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz... You can't say nothin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we get with a counselor. At the  church, maybe they's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the final interruption) I don't love ya no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words are daggers. Laz is wounded beyond concealment. Rose picks up her purse, preparing to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you hurtin'. But, like I  say, this the only life I got. (waits for him to  respond) I said my piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and attempts to walk away. Laz grips her tight by the wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God forgive you, for how you done  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Daddy told me that a younger woman  would bleed me dry. And that's what  you did. Ya bled me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would'a chopped my arm off if you  asked. And this how you do me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAZ, I said let...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better pray, gal. You better  pray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanks free) Don't you lay a CURSE ON ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole cafe is silent. All eyes are on Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to customers) Yeah, go'on! Look! See if I give a  shit about any of you people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gone, right out the front door.

What, you  sick?

dialogues.text: Laz drives an old green Ford pick-up. He pulls the truck to the front of the feed store and kills the engine. LINCOLN, a 13-year-old black boy, comes out of the open  loading door.

The tractor lunges  forward, trampling the garden, ripping the flowers to shr

dialogues.text: (pours a shot of vodka) Here. Pound this and I'll join you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae and Jesse take a strong shot. It burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more. Fuck the chaser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pound one more, Rae notices Gill, Ronnie's friend staring at her from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATSON and MARK approach Jesse and Rae. They are both  sophomores, both skinny and harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You robotrippin' tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae peeks at Gill maneuvering through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rummages in his  pockets) Got eight packs of DXM. Oxycontin.  Got a shit load of Coricidin if you  want to get out-a-body, n'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just trying to get me outta my  clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae pushes through the crowd of drunken kids to get to Gi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like I can't go out and  have fun with my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm Ronnie's spy or  somethin'? Come tomorrow that dumb- ass gonna be halfway round the world  tryin' to keep his head on his  shoulders. You think he's gonna be  thinkin' about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae pushes through the crowd, back toward the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Batson) How many to fuck me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of: Batson popping out five red cough pills. R swallowing all five and chasing them with vodka. Conner's girl falls off his lap. Kell laughs. The laughter echoes grows as we:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: CLOSE ANGLES: We never quite see the whole of what is imp Rae's eyes, Jesse's mouth, a boy's shoulder. The room is packed with bodies. Rae laughs with pleasure her eyes attempt to focus. The kid on top of her finishes and rolls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is straddling a guy in an arm chair, Chinese-eyed a bouncing. Rae tries to respond coherently as another foot player rolls her over on all fours and takes her from beh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Oh... I'm just on a water bed... And  it's just... so... Goddamn... funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few coughs. Rae focuses to see a younger guy sitting at her eye level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't the kicker, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz let me tell you, you boys gotta  run the ball more. You get into a  kicking game, ya'll gonna lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I put it in your mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz kills the rest of his whiskey. He squeezes his eyes c as the liquor burns his throat. He tosses the bottle into trash bag he is holding. Laz continues throwing out all of Rose's make-up and hair products. With one broad sweep, he cleans off her vanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens the front door and tosses the two bags outside. Stumbling, he kneels next to the coiled radiator against wall opposite the door. He talks to it like an old friend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seem like you and me... we drove her  away. That's what we did. Now we... (singing softly) Drinkin' muddy water... a'sleep in a  hollow log...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pulls out a guitar case from under the bed. He wipes layer of dust off and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gently cradles the guitar in his big hands and sits at his kitchen table. Tunes the strings. He closes his eyes, swimming in drunken sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz plays the blues, Mississippi, Bentonian style: one gu one voice, a mess of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing, his eyes  closed) Just like a bird without a feather,  you know  I'm lost without your love.  Just like a bird without a feather,  you know  I'm lost without your love.  You know I need your love just like  the angels need heaven above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music continues as we:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lazarus's blues is all we hear as four guys chase Rae thr the woods. She is in her shirt and panties, wearing footb shoulder pads. She is completely wasted. Lost. The ground rocks back and forth with each step. Trees pass in a slow-motion haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Well I sure did shot my baby, but I  did it because she did me wrong.  Well I sure did shot my baby, but I  did it because she did me wrong.  You know the judge called it murder  now the penitentiary is my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae grips a tree to steady herself, but a team member tac her. The woods spin and distort as someone mounts her wit ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) I loved that woman, she said she  didn't love no one but me.  I loved that woman, she said she  didn't love no one but me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae smiles as she lifts her hand up to the stars, passing the writhing back of the guy on top of her. If she could  just grab a star she would feel safe again. She tries to snatch one. She can't. Her hand drops as the boy stands and takes off after his friends tossing the  football. Rae lies motionless on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Yeah but I caught my baby cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear rolls down Laz's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Now my home ain't where it used to  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His guitar groans its last for the night.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rae is wasted. She is still wearing her shirt, panties an shoulder pads as she steps over passed-out teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jes? Jesse? (trips over a sprinkler) Oh shit... Wait... Wait... STOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae doesn't look up. The Coricidin is tripping her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughing) The ground is... turnin' upside down.  I'm gonna... (coughing) I'm gonna fall off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill reaches down and pulls off the shoulder pads. The  coughing fit passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That feels so much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill's truck flies down the dark road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is looking out the window, drifting in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you had a skirt earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill pulls to the side of the road and kills the engine. watches Rae tilt her head from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing you got... I've heard  people say, you'd fuck a tree if it  was handy. I can see that. (shakes his head) But that nigger Tehronne. Thinks  he's some player cuz he hustles dope  and stolen hubcaps. I mean, I can  see a tree. But that piece of shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost in hazy sorrow) I begged him. Don't see why he had  to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you did. Just had to get that  black cock up in you. I swear to  God. What Ronnie sees... you disgust  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill grabs her legs and spreads them with no resistance. head rolls from side to side on the truck seat as Gill un his pants. Rae starts giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you laughin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) You don't got half what Tehronne  got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill flinches upright. A rage builds in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside the steamed truck window, we see Gill beat R repeatedly. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled from the  inside) Get up! I ain't playin'! OPEN YOUR  GODDAMN EYES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. He opens the truck door, fear in his eyes. Rae isn't movi Blood is on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hasty idea. He pushes her out of the truck. She falls t the dark pavement in a tangle of her own limbs. The door slams. Gill floors the gas. Rae lies motionless  alone under the stars. Her watch alarm goes off: Beep-beep. Beep-beep. Beep-beep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is asleep on the bus, unaware that his watch alarm beeping at him. A Guardsman sitting next to him shakes Ronnie awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie silences the alarm. He regards the watch with sadn and affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus roars past. The red brake lights fade into night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus has fallen asleep sitting at his kitchen table. H eyes open. Standing is difficult. The guitar falls to the floor. The phone rings. Dizziness hits, but he manages to pick u the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. is on his cell phone. He is placing hymnals in the b racks of the church pews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bojo called. Said you got to see  your brother at the long end of a  broken bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna preach 'bout turnin' the  other cheek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you did alright by God under  the circumstances. (R.L. pauses) Your people are here for you, Laz.  This is your home. No shame in showing  your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know if God wanna see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows where ya at. Just answer  the door if he come knockin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus steps out onto his porch. He picks up the trash b full of Rose's things and walks down the gravel drive to road.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Laz tosses the bags inside his trash cans. He's really hung over this morning. His eyes squeeze shut he grips his neck in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmmmmmm... Mm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open. They remain fixed beyond us. The pain in h face is replaced with grave confusion. Rae lies on the side of the road. Her T-shirt and panties are damp from the early morning m her face caked with dried blood. Her skin is deathly whit her mouth open, her eyes shut and swollen. Lazarus carefully steps toward her. He leans down over he face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet... Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae coughs. Laz flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams against the wall as it swings open. Laz is carrying Rae, unconscious and limp, in his arms. He lays her down on the couch by the radiator. He pulls a quilt over her cold skin. With a twist of the valve the  radiator moans to life. Laz takes out his bandana and cleans her face. He tries t wake her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little lady? Miss? You need to open  your eyes for me. Could ya do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes open slightly -- just slits of white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. There we go. Just like  you doin'. Go'on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whispers as she touches her fingers to his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a raspy inhale) Teh... Tehronne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tehronne? Tehronne done this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A labored breath followed by the most pitiful cough fit. tries to calm her as her lungs fight for oxygen. Laz look scared as the coughing stops in a desperate wheeze follow by silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pulls the phone off its cradle on the wall and flips  through the phone book. His fingers scan down the listings and stops on POLICE  DEPARTMENT. He dials and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a recorded voice) You've reached the Fisherville Police  Department. Your call will be answered  in the order it was received. If  this is an emergency, please, hang  up and dial 9-1-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slam! Fingers hit the phone cradle. Lazarus dials 911. As soon as he places the phone to his ear, he looks over Rae sprawled out on his couch. Her bare legs can be seen  peeking out from under the quilt. Fear hits him. He slams the phone down again. Laz crosses to the couch and gently touches her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I'm'a go into town. Get you some  medicine to fix you up. You just  rest, okay, gal? You just sleep. Get  that chill out'cha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz touches the radiator. It burns him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz's Ford roars down the shaded street towards town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz parks his truck in front of MACON DRUGS and heads ins An old black man named RED sits on a bench next to an old white man in his early eighties holding a cane. RED is th paid caretaker of MELVIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the squash this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good, Mister Melvin. I'll bring  ya some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz rushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The variety of cough medicine confuses Laz as he examines them. ANGELA approaches Laz. She is dressed in a floral print d with a white lab coat. Angela has a few extra pounds on h but she wears it well with her caring face and sweet mann

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Oh! Gave me a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's these soft shoes I  wear for my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hurt it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing most of my day. They're  for support. (a smile) Didn't see you in church this mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to lie) Been on the crop. May need to get  some extra hands if I don't want to  work on Sundays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. It's good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela wants the conversation to continue but Laz remains silent. She smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Laz. You can talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little niece... she got this deep  cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take her to a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggles to lie) No. No, she can't go. Mean to say...  they's just no money fo'a doctor.  Her daddy left for a job, and uh...  give her to me to look on. I just... (a pitiful pause) I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snot and spittle has run down the side of Rae's face -- h eyelids stick together as she tries to open them. There is a creak, followed by another. Rae has become awa that someone is slowly walking up the front porch. The door opens. Silhouetted in the day's blinding light i white man in his 40's. His face is indistinguishable to R affected gaze. Is this a dream? He stands above her and lights a cigarette. The Zippo lig clasps shut. The man lowers it to his side where Rae can it clearly. A bald eagle is printed on the side, a sight  that makes Rae's eyes open wide in horror. Her breath grows deeper -- a girlish plea. This is no dre it's a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-mm... Mm-mm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive hand slaps down over her mouth. Her crusted eye peer above the hairy knuckles. He sucks on the cigarette. red cherry blazes at the end. The man pushes the blanket of her and grips her panties. Rae's eyes close. She knows what is next. In his clenched fist, the panties are ripped off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae flinches awake from the fever-induced nightmare and f to the wooden floor, drenched in sweat. Weakened and shak she scampers away, finally collapsing in the kitchen. Her hand reaches out and lands on the strings of Laz's guitar the floor. She grips the steel strings with her trembling fingers. A single bass note twangs as she passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela stands between the aisles, motioning Laz to approa away from the girl at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your niece older than 12?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she older than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a white box with cough syrup inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister got a bad cough with her  pneumonia. I just copied her  prescription. You don't need to pay  anything... just take it. But if she  gets worse, you give me a call. I  wrote my number on the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gonna get you in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if no one finds out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz doesn't know what to say. He puts the box in his pock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (suddenly awkward) Oh. My wife. She had a card here for  her migraine pills. She ain't gonna  be around no more... So if you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already tossed that out. (takes a step closer) Somethin' you should'a done to that  woman long ago... how she treated  you. Of course, that's none of my  business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Don't make it less true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela returns the smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens his truck door and stops. At the pool-hall acro the square, Laz sees a green Cutlass with chrome rims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz enters the empty pool hall. Tehronne is playing a gam with a skinny playa-wanna-be dressed in flea-market Fubu. CHARLIE, the owner, approaches Laz from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lazarus. We closed up on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a word with Tehronne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to the back) Yo, T! Laz wanna holla at cha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on back, Cuz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie nods Laz on. He crosses to the back pool table as Tehronne sinks the 8. Tehronne looks at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you call it a game when only one  man win each time? I think you call  it a damn shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word wit'cha. In private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tehronne hands his friend the pool cue. The two take a fe steps away to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need some weed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been years since I fooled with that. (tries to find the  words) You know a white girl? Dirty blond  hair, split down the middle like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) That ain't up to me to hook you up.  Naw what I mean? She her own, you  know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't pimp that. (silence) You talkin' about who I think you  talkin' about, you mean Rae. Rae  Doole. Sexy little split tail, like  you say. I can't hook you up with  that. I got two girls. One ain't in  town, the other one pregnant. So...  you on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Rae... you get with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Who hasn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got a spare minute she'll snatch  up anyone... but me, I'm different.  Sometimes she need the real deal, so  she call me up. Girl got an itch.  You know... what's a nigga to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She like it rough? You like beatin'  on her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't my scene. If that's  somethin' you into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, hold up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that girl is in my favor. You  heard me, nigga? You fuck with her  rough, and you got me to fuck wit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You collar that dog, boy. I ain't  gonna hurt nobody. Just wanted to  know who she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I say, you wanna hook that up...  I ain't in ya way. That switch of  hers been all over this town. Got  that sickness, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'chu sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She a freak. Got what you call a  sexual addiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus looks at him with a furrowed brow. Confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'chu sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm tellin' you. Girl gotta get  dick or she go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens his own door with caution. He turns to see Rae  sprawled in his kitchen in her panties and T-shirt. He ru to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gal? Miss Rae? Rae, you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus lifts her sweaty body off the floor and moves her back to the couch. Consciousness briefly returns to Rae in her feverish haze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white-knuckled hand clutched around her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae flinches and flails. She falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, now. Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's eyes are open and filled with fear. She struggles t flee as Laz holds her in place, trying to reassure her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I ain't gonna hurt'cha. Calm  down, Miss. (she fights, coughs) Listen... Listen... LISTEN NOW, GAL! (Rae settles in his  grip) I ain't gonna hurt ya, hear? Gotta  get you well. Now, look me... HEY!  Look me in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is too weak to talk or move. Laz clutches her small f in his dark hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes. Go'on, now. You need  to see, ain't no harm here. Ain't no  harm. (Rae calms) My name is Lazarus Woods. And I ain't  gonna let you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's eyes roll back. Lazarus looks terrified as she cranes her head back and  forward. Her mouth opens. In her sickened state, with the force of something evil a deep inside, Rae clasps her open mouth over Laz's. A shri sounds in his brain as he holds her tighter, allowing the kiss to grow in intensity. Rae falls to her stomach as La abruptly stands and stumbles across the room. What he see chills him to the bone. Rae is writhing on the floor as if she is possessed -- a  rant of raspy words pour from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you don't... touch me... s'no...  NO! Mm-mm... Mm-MMMMMMMMMMMMM! N- N'you FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus gets spooked by what he is seeing. He looks to th mantle. His weathered Bible lies in a coat of dust. He pi it up as a wave of the burning hits Rae. She clutches her breast and crotch, rolling from side to  side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-mm... mm-mm... Ma-muh... Ma-MUH! (sudden anger, shouting) See... S... See if'I GIVE... GIVE'A...  SHIT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is shouting at the customers in the cafe. Her eyes a white like Rae's. Her voice is not her own but that of Ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) 'BOUT ANY OF YOU PEOPLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz runs out of his own home, not even shutting the door  behind him. He gets half way down his drive, the Bible st clutched in his hand. He stops. In a panic, Laz opens his Bible, places it down on the dr face up, creating a barrier to evil. He hears a choking c inside the house. Rae is fighting for breath beyond the d door. Silence. Laz reaches down and picks up his Bible. A passage catches his eye. As he reads, the fear vanishes from his face. His back straightens. His jaw tightens. He looks back at his house, his faith is renewed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bible is slammed down on top of the toilet tank. The  bathtub faucet coughs as Laz twists the cold water knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freezer door opens. He snatches four trays of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trays crack. The ice cubes bounce into the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's lips are dried and split as she pants, lost in dizz fever. Laz lifts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz kneels on one knee to put her into the tub. A horrible cry from Rae as Laz wrestles with her, keeping her submerged in the ice cold water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, child, I know. Gotta break  that fever now. (Rae sobs, struggles) Don't mean to hurt'chu. But I ain't  lettin' you die. (holding her down) I AIN'T LETTIN' YOU DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is motionless. Exhausted. Her eyes are open but blind Her lip trembles. Her body shakes from the freezing water Laz rubs the hair from her face gently. He reaches over t the Bible on the toilet and opens it to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put fear of the Devil in me, gal.  Got me spooked like I's a kid, I  tell you. (flips through the  pages) But the good Lord, He showed me what  to do. He come knockin' like my man  R.L. say... listen here... (Rae sobs like a child) This here Matthew. He talkin' on how  Jesus was healin' the sick. And a  man come up to the disciples and he  say... (reads deliberately) Have mercy on my son, for he is a  lunatic, and sore vexed... (to Rae) He got the devil in his mind and  sores on his skin. (reads) And he brought the boy to the  disciples, but they could NOT cure  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's shivering is abating. Her eyes fight to stay open. touches her forehead to test her temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) Then Jesus answered and said, O  faithless and perverse generation...  how long shall I suffer you? Bring  the boy hither to me. And Jesus  rebuked the devil. (to Rae) You hear that? (reads) Then the disciples say... Why could  not we cast the devil out? And Jesus  said unto them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's eyes begin to close. Laz gently touches her head to rile her awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen now... This what he sayin' to  us. He say... (reads) If ye have faith... if ye have faith  as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall  say unto a mountain, remove hence...  and it... shall... move. And  nothin'... nothin' shall be impossible  to you. (to Rae) You hear that? You just need a bit  of faith. You just gotta believe you  gonna get well, like I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches her forehead again. Her eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. You coolin' down.  Okay. You rest. Okay. You rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz leans against the wall, spent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cicadas sing in a rising chorus as the clouds above f from copper to crimson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faint echo of Rae's fevered panting. She lies on the couch wrapped in a quilt, shivering. Her  eyes remain closed, her face drenched with sweat. Laz has cleaned her facial wounds, using a few Band-Aids.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: An explosion ignites the windows surrounding the cabin. R jolts awake, terror pervades her as she gasps at the fire ball outside the window. She struggles to her feet and listens. A faint sound can heard through the roar of the flames. beep beep... beep  beep... beep beep... beep beep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Ronnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae stumbles to the door, weak and dizzy. She grips the d knob and pulls the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae races outside, tripping down the front porch steps. S looks off at the blaze in the squash field. She frantical races toward the fire, the beeping increases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie... RONNIE!

dialogues.speaker: BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP...
dialogues.text: At the center of the blaze is an upside down Humvee. To t left of the vehicle, a few soldier's bodies lay scattered Rae's legs lose all strength, she collapses and crawls ac the squash plants. A far away voice is heard over the roaring flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gal? Gal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae crawls across a fallen soldier, following the sound o Ronnie's alarm. She struggles to breathe, she almost fain She finds a soldier face down. With all her strength she  turns him over. It is Ronnie, wide-eyed and lifeless. An awful groan comes out of Rae -- crippling sorrow. She  pulls on his vest trying to wake him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Nn-nn... Nn-nn... no... N'RONNIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAL! YOU HEARIN' MY VOICE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae looks up. The flaming humvee is gone. She is not pull on Ronnie's vest, but the tangled vines of a squash plant Laz stands at a safe distance, silhouetted in moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You travelin' right now, gal. You  asleep and you don't even know it. (extends his hand) Now... come on inside with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae looks like a terrified child. Her eyes well with tear as she shakes her head. Laz takes a step toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-mm... Mm-mm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, gal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and runs away as best she can. Laz chases after her. He's much older than her and a bit slower, but her  balance betrays her. Laz wraps his arms around her. Rae screams to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! NOOO! NOOOOOOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, stillness. Rae lies limp in Laz's arms, unconsc He reaches down and lifts her wrist to his face. The gree screen of the digital watch pulsates with the alarm. He pushes the side button. The beeping stops. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz lays Rae back onto his couch. Her eyes open into slit She can see Laz's form over her like the man in her night Rae grabs Laz's wrist. He flinches with her force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the whisper of a  child) Is'okay... Is'okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling with exhaustion, Rae moves Laz's hand to her b stomach. She rubs it slowly up and down her form,  suggestively. Laz slips his hand away and claps it tight over her eyes. Rae holds her breath, waiting to be molested, her lip  quivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing deep and  soft) Goin' over that hill. Goin' over  that hill. Well, I ain't gonna stop  until I reach my God's top. I'm goin'  over the hill. Well I went to the  valley, I didn't go to stay. Soul  got happy, I stayed all day. I'm  goin' over that hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae relaxes and falls into a deep sleep. Laz backs away from her, a touch of fear in his heart. Th voice of Tehronne is heard from earlier in the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She a freak. Got what you call a  sexual addiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'chu sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm tellin' you. Girl gotta get  dick or she go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus looks at Tehronne with a furrowed brow, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First hooked up with that bitch when  she was 16. Girl was fuckin' the  principal and two of her teachers.  You know coach Reynolds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tapped that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus opens his barn, slicing through the darkness with his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She been bumpin' around all her life,  hookin' up with whoever keep her fed  and fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the other side, pulls on a beaded chain tur on the single bulb above his work table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen her give it up on park benches,  back of trucks, hoopty hoods, you  name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens an old wooden box on his work table. He looks  inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz looks ill. Tehronne checks his pager briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever seen a train run on a woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanin' like a team of fellas go to  work on her and she don't even break  a sweat. (puts his pager away) She into football, you know. You got  a letter on your jacket you get that  pussy in ya lap. I ain't playin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tehronne's friend breaks on the pool table with a sharp c Lazarus is genuinely disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How a girl get like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus reaches inside the box and pulls out the end of a old chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl got a sickness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain rattles as Laz walks backwards, pulling the lon chain from the box. The shouting of his brother can be he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'chu gonna do? Huh? Nothin'. YOU  AIN'T GONNA DO NOTHIN'! NOTHIN'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the chain snags, yanking the box over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus is bent over, harvesting his tomatoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing to himself) Tell me who's that writin'? John the  Revelator. Wrote the book of the  seven seals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz enters his home. He crosses to the kitchen and pours  himself a glass of water. Dripping with sweat, he steps back into the room, downing the last of his water. He lowers the glass, noticing Rae  looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae lifts her head off the pillow. Laz comes to her side helps her sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy now. Don't rush it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a scratchy whisper) How long... how long I been out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been in and out goin' on two...  maybe two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe it) Two days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After your fever broke, you'd wake  up in spells... long enough to get  that medicine in ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae sits up on the couch, the quilt wrapped around her wa She looks at the cough syrup bottle on the side table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found you on the side of the road.  Someone took to beatin' on you pretty  bad. You know who done that to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae touches the cut over her eye. That evening is still a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ronnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Wait. He left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae lifts her head, revealing tears in her eyes. She gets mad at herself and wipes them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't got any money... for fixin'  me up and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I better be on my way. Don't  wanna put you out no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it'd be best if you stayed put  while we talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw'sir... I gotta be on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best try gettin' ya wits about you  'fore you try to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae struggles for balance as she attempts to stand. The q falls away as a heavy chain slides off the couch and thud on the floor by her feet. Rae feels a tug. She looks down to see a dark chain locked around her thin waist and coiled on the floor. The opposite end is locked around the side coil of the radiator. She is chained to the house, a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me say somethin' first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you got me chained?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way I see it, it's gonna take a while  for you to get right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck you been doin' to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't laid a hand on ya but to  ease yo fever... Remember like I  say, I found you in the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanks at the chain  around her waist) Get this Goddamn thing off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae stumbles as she moves away from Laz. Laz tries to rea her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, no harm's come to you... and I  aim to keep it that way. Ain't  gonna... gonna run a train over ya...  or however you call it... see... you  was runnin' wild on me... these fever  dreams you was havin'... these fits.  I'd be chasin' you all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm woke now... you can take  this off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gal, you ain't right yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right enough to stand on my own  two feet. Now take this Goddamn chain  off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you let men treat ya like they  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men you up under. How you let  them do ya like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grips the chain) Do me? Do me like this, you mean?  Like chainin' me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talkin' about. (beat) All that mess with ya teachers and...  boys in the backs of trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) The hell you know about me?! You got  no right to talk to me about that  shit! The hell you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I've saved ya life, gal. I can do  and say whatever the fuck I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae begins to feel a pang of panic. She goes to the chain locked around the radiator. She yanks on it a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give ya enough chain so's you can  get about the house. Get you to the  kitchen. You need the bathroom, it'll  reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got everything we need. Plenty of  food. Ya medicine still got a few  good swallows in it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?! (Laz can't answer) WHATEVER YOU GONNA DO TO ME, JUST DO  IT! AND LET ME GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God saw to it to put you in my path.  And I aim to cure ya of your  wickedness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This statement terrifies Rae. The fear can be seen in her eyes. She backs away -- the chain scrapes across the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You some kind'a pervert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some crazy Jesus freak, gonna fuck  the spirit into me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my house, you watch that lip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious, near tears) Look it, mister... you wanna have  your way, you take it. I'll do  whatever you want. But you gotta let  me go. You can't do this! You can't  KEEP ME HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick. You got a sickness... we  broke that fever... we gonna break  that hold the devil got on ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae pushes Laz back and bolts for the door. Laz falls bac against the side table by the couch, toppling the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams against the house as Rae rushes out in her wolf shirt and panties -- the chain trailing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) HELP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz watches as the coil unravels and snaps taut, yanking the old radiator. Clank! The chain whips Rae down to the ground. Laz watche as dust flies of the radiator with each tug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMEBODY!

dialogues.speaker: CLANK
dialogues.text: The fear in Laz's face is replaced with a grin as he watc his radiator hold firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMEBODY HELP ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Rae bucks and screams, yanking on the chain like wild mustang. Her bare feet and legs are soiled with fres mud and grass as she claws at the ground. Laz crosses to the radiator and pats it like a proud pare his wedding ring clicks against the iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the radiator) Ain't gonna be moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps outside with resolve and strength. He picks up t chain and wraps it around his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAL! I ain't gonna be moved on this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz yanks her back, dragging her towards him. He grips th taut chain with his other hand and yanks her closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET ME GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can holla y'self hoarse. Ain't  gonna bend my will. (pulls her closer) Right or wrong, you gonna mind me. (Pulls her again) Gonna suffer you like Jesus say, to  the FAITHLESS and the PERVERSE  GENERATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is spent. She turns to look at her captor as he wrang her back to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you get up! And you get in my  house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae spits at Laz. Bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is screaming and grunting as Laz, standing in his kit tugs on the chain around the door-jam like he's drawing w from a well. Outside Rae struggles to hold onto the porch post. Laz pu hard, lifting her lower torso off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! IT HURTS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose doin' is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz yanks. Rae loses her grip and slams onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... OKAY! I'M COMIN' IN! NOW  QUIT IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pulling stops. Rae picks herself up. Her knees and ha are scraped and bleeding. The two stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say we talk. Just take a seat on the  sofa. I'll get us somethin' cool to  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz crosses to the kitchen. Rae sits down on the couch,  noticing the fallen lamp on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not remember. But you spent  a whole half day in my tub, tryin'  to cool down. Melted four ice trays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes preparing the two waters. He crosses into the front room. Rae is not there. CRASH! Rae smashes the lamp on Laz's head. The water glas shatter as Laz falls to the floor. Rae picks up a wooden chair and breaks it over his back.  Before she can do any more damage, Laz grabs her by the w and throws her to the couch. Rae falls to the floor. Laz stumbles on his feet as he  clutches his bleeding head. He loses his cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wicked little bitch... gonna cut  me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna get a lot more a'that, you  keep me locked up like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae freezes as she sees Laz undo his belt buckle. Her bre starts to quiver as she deeply inhales and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I'm gonna let you do me like  that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz whips his belt off and wraps the buckle around his fi He stops in his tracks. Rae is panting and shaking. Her m finger is scratching at her own thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regaining his cool) Okay, now... I ain't gonna hit'cha. (the burning is  starting) Just lost my cool there. (he throws the belt  away) Now take that look out'cha eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her anguished hum can be heard through her clenched teeth she rocks back and forth. Her hands wander down to her in thighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. You stop that foolishness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Hm-mm... Hm-mm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said... STOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of crying) I CAN'T!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae gets dizzy. She rests the top of her head on the floo and sways back and forth. Laz rushes out the front door. As the wave hits, Rae twists and turns, wrapping the chai around her. She grips the radiator with both hands and re her face against the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmmmm... Stop-it!... STOP-IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave is about to build in to a powerful climax. Rae g for breath. The door slams open. Laz drenches her with a gallon of co well water from a tin bucket. Rae inhales and freezes. La waits and watches. The burning is gone. Laz kneels next to her and gently frees her bare ankle fr the tangled chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both seated on the front porch with paper plates their laps. Laz watches with amusement as Rae tears into chicken and gobbles up the vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put some back ache into growin'  them greens. You should slow down  and see how they taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae remains under Lazarus' intense gaze as the cicadas si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae stares off at orange clouds and purple sky. She takes step to her left, walking through the parallel rows of sq The chain gently rattles behind her. Laz has given her ab 20 feet of slack. He holds the chain tight around his fis Rae grins, standing proud in her wolf shirt and panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like this? Walkin' me through  this field like I's your mule?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't sit all day on that sofa. Need  to get your legs strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sassy) If I break one you gonna shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae teases Laz by adjusting her panties. She turns back t the sunset and stretches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's smoldering eyes don't leave Laz as he chains her to the radiator. Laz nervously preaches, trying to avoid the sight of her bare legs curled up on his couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Daddy was one of the first mens  to organize soil conservation in  these parts. That's a group of  farmers, you know, each season they'd  rotate the crop. Know why it's best  to rotate em like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz moves in close and starts applying antibacterial crea to the cut above Rae's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz once in a while soil need a  change. Corn take up a lot of nitrate  in the fertilizer. So next crop what  ya do is plant ya some soy beans.  That give off a lot of nitrate. Change  keeps it all growin' and growin'  strong. (regarding the eye) Sting a bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Itches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means ya healin'. (a nod) So all this farmin' make me think on  Matthew. Matthew 13. The parable of  the sower? Man toss seed on rock, on  the wayside, some fell in thorns...  you know the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz starts putting the cream on her scabbed knees. He rub them gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seed that land on good soil is  for them who hear the word of God...  and understand the word of God. Not  enough for you to hear what I'm  sayin', you gotta understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I get it. What's Matthew  doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gal... Matthew ain't doin' shit...  this just a story... (quelling his  frustration) Look it. I've seen it in nature,  I've seen it in men. Ya got to change  up your crop. Cuz that seed ain't  gettin' in. (Rae remains silent) Ya gotta cut this shit out. Got no  cause to be up under these fools,  ruttin' on ya like you a bitch. Like  you somebody's dog. No woman... who  joins in union with Almighty God...  or man... in the sanctity of  marriage... should degrade herself...  and bend to ANOTHER MAN'S WILL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is aware that Laz is somewhere else, talking to someo else other than her. There is anger in his tone as he rub ointment on her bare, scabbed knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) My God, gal, don't you got no SENSE?  I ain't sayin' I ain't weak? Shit.  Playin' guitar in the blood-bucket  jukes all ya life... a nigga learn  how to sin, let me tell you! (grips her by the  legs) I GOT SIN IN ME! I AIN'T GO'N LIE!  BUT I GOT RESPECT! AND ALL YOU GOT  IS BILE, GAL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIVIN' UP THAT SWITCH LIKE A TRAMP!  BEHIND MY BACK AND KILL MY BABY...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae yanks free of Laz's grip, recoiling on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OFF ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz awakens from his rant. He blinks and stands. A sudden shame overtakes him. He crosses into the kitchen to hide the sink. He pours Rae a glass of water and returns to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering her the  glass) Didn't mean to go off on a tear like  I did. I just got to thinkin' about  things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae leans up into his face. The glass of water is touchin her chest. Laz remains hypnotized by her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it you old men gotta talk so  much? Like little boys, gotta talk  yourself into fuckin' me. (his knuckles touch  her skin) We can take our time. I'm grown. I  get it. (she leans even closer) You wanna give me 'nother bath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz stands and backs away. He quickly leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz looks at himself in the reflection of Rose's vanity  mirror, listening to Rae stir in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cicadas are screaming outside. Rae is beginning to br deep, the burning is coming on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She folds her arms over her chest, her middle finger  scratching her elbow. The anxiety is too much. She rolls  over until the chain pulls taut against the radiator. Rae has wrapped herself in a tangle of chain. Her breathi relaxes. Her eyes close. She sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train rumbles past in the blue hue of dawn. Laz pulls his truck next to two other fruit and vegetable vendors: ARCHIE and GENE. Archie is an old black man in his early seventies. Gene i short white man closer to Laz's age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes our fortune. We been doin'  good for ourselves since you been  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz sets up his folding table and uncovers his produce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all know when Ella Mae's open up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needin' to buy some pantyhose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some dresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene looks at Archie and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae snaps awake. She is wet with sweat from the morning h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae drags the chain behind her as she crosses to the fron door and looks outside. No truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She folds her arms and looks into the kitchen. There on t table is a covered plate and a small bottle of milk. Rae  reads a note on top of the plate: BE BACK FOR SUPPER. She pulls off the top plate and finds sausage links, eggs biscuits, sliced tomatoes, and sliced peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to choke a Goddamn horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She yanks her chain. It rattles across the floor as she s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz looks out of place in his faded overalls surrounded b bright colors of Ella Mae's dress shop. ELLA MAE is a wide woman with white hair in her late fift

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm needin' some women's clothes. A  few dresses. Maybe some shoes. But  they gotta be nice. They gotta be  proper. Clothes a woman would want,  where she could feel and look like a  woman without... you know, lookin'  like a tramp or a hussy or somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ella Mae turns to her assistant, Rhonda. Rhonda is a 19-y old black girl. She turns back to Laz, unsure how to proc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, sir... do you have a size in  mind for what you're lookin' for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to Rhonda) That young lady's size, right'cher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that makes it easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae sits down in the tub, still wearing her T-shirt and  panties. Looking up at the shower head above she turns on the cold water and yanks up on the shower knob. Cold water sprays down over her. She gasps and then relax laying back in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is at the counter. Rhonda is putting the shoes and cl in two shopping bags while Ella Mae rings him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I hope these will work for  your niece. She can always come back  in and swap sizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus points to a small display of fine lotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind I ask, what's all this business  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are whipped body creams. It's  like a lotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some women prefer not to scent their  bodies with perfume. So now they  have scented creams. They help  moisturize a woman's skin. (unscrewing a jar) This one's my favorite. It's called  Ginger Souffle. I recommend...  applying the cream while the skin is  still damp. So... perhaps just after  a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (likes what he smells) I'll take a jar of that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae rattles into the kitchen, her damp clothes clinging t her form. She picks up Laz's guitar off the table and pla it in her lap. She plucks a few random strings out of boredom and smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same apathetic girl is working the front counter as L enters the drug store with a basket of arranged vegetable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' for Miss Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz makes his way to the back of the store. He spies Ange in the back pharmacy, sorting pills for a pick-up. He wat her work for a moment until, finally, she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz waits as Angela rounds the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brung you a little basket of  goodies. Fresh squash, tomatoes,  some okra, butter beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the basket) You didn't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to say how much I  appreciate you helping me the other  day. My niece, she's cured up, and I  got you to thank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's good. I'm happy to hear  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela smiles. There is tension and attraction between th two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look here. I got somethin' special  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela is flush as Laz moves closer than he has ever been before. He reaches in the basket for the jar of cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is a whipped... body cream.  And it's got a smell to it. Tell me  what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz holds the jar up to her nose. Angela closes her eyes smells. Her expression says enough -- she loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call this Ginger Souffle. Best  if it... if it go on your skin just  after you been in a hot tub... or  shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela takes the lotion from his hand. She is subtle and  demure, but the woman is deeply affected. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was very sweet of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Hope you enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela watches Laz as he walks out the door. The apatheti girl moves up behind Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens his truck and waves goodbye to Old Red. Melvin holding a healthy squash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be on the square later on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got all my honey-do's done with. I'm  headin' home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay cool. It's a hot one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pulls away in his truck and rounds the corner just as R.L. crosses the street. He steps over to talk to Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Red. Was that Laz just left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes'sir, Rev'rend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae occasionally strums an awful chord as she sings playf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to sing) You are my sunshine. My only sunshine.  You make me happy when skies are  gray. You'll never know dear how  much I love you. Please don't take  my sunshine away. A voice from outside  spins her around. The guitar barks  as Rae slams it down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Lazarus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae stays hidden as she peeks out the front window. Linco is standing before the house holding an old picnic basket Rae's middle finger begins scraping against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Laz... I come for the butter  beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae fights her dizziness. She crawls to the radiator as s hears each creak of Lincoln crossing to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zippo with the bald eagle closes. A smoldering cigare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae flinches and grits her teeth as Lincoln knocks on the door: Knock, knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't seen you on the square. Mister  Laz, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning has started: deep gasps, itching, anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried now) Mister Lazarus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae watches the shadows of Lincoln's shoes under the door They wait patiently and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln walks down the porch steps and stops. Thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae inches upward, pulling herself up the radiator so she can stand. Her panting has waned. Suddenly the front door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Laz, I'm comin' inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln can't believe what he sees. Rae is chained around the waist, damp and barely clothed. Her eyes bore into Li like an owl zeroing in on a helpless jackrabbit. She rips her shirt off in one tug over her head. Lincoln can't move. The picnic basket hits the floor. His mouth hangs open in shock as Rae steps towards him and la her open mouth on the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! Rae shuts the door. Laz steers his Ford truck up the drive and parks. He take his time getting out and removing the shopping bags. He o the door and goes inside. His curses can be heard from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIT BOY! WHAT THE HELL YOU...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln is tossed off the porch, clinging to his overalls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAN'T LEAVE YOU ALONE FOR ONE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears and fear come to Lincoln as Laz steps out onto the  porch, fuming with rage. Lincoln backs away expecting a good beating. He starts ru up the drive but stops as R.L.'s Olds rolls up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln, come on back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln darts past Laz and runs into the barn, clutching overalls. R.L. stops the car halfway down the drive and s out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that Lincoln James I seen run  off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine. Just had a bad fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's his britches round his knees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L., you gonna have to get on. I  can't have nobody round my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. starts walking up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get a call from Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't got nothin' to do with  that woman. Just don't want nobody  around me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' wrong with ya phone? Been  callin' the last few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. stops in his tracks as Lazarus pulls out his hunting rifle from the rack behind his seat in his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' dove huntin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go, R.L.. I ain't foolin'  this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sayin' that gun's for me if I  don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spell it out, Laz. Man big enough to  pull a gun best have a tongue in his  mouth if he ain't got a brain in his  head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
