dialogues.text: Laz is struggling. The rifle feels suddenly strange to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna talk me outta shit  no more. I got my mind made up and I  ain't gonna be moved on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Ain't gonna be moved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got no place for preachin' here. Not  now. So you do as I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still stepping closer) Or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to TURN BACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. pushes his chest up against the rifle and shouts bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU GO'ON AND SHOOT ME, KILLA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz's heart is breaking. He is pointing a gun at his only friend. R.L. snatches the rifle out of Laz's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ought'a stomp yo ass pointing this  at me. (unloads the rifle) Always gotta bring up the preachin'.  Like you just a sheep in my flock  and all I'm good for is poundin' on  a pulpit. (gets in Laz's face) Dammit, Laz... we may not be blood.  But we sucked off the same old nurse  since the day we was slapped on the  ass. And you gonna point a gun at  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear rolls down Laz's cheek. The shame is unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you in some trouble, than WE gonna  figure somethin' out. You and me. (hands him a bandana) Wipe your face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz takes the bandana and wipes the tears away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... this got anything to do with  Rose? (Laz shakes his head) Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door creaks open. R.L. carefully steps inside. Rae is sitting on the couch, looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of tears) I didn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae doesn't respond. R.L. quickly steps outside shutting door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. shakes his head as Laz follows him off the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you outta ya GODDAMN MIND?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man like you ought not take the Lord's  name like you just done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A naked woman, chained in ya house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you the truth, dammit. I  found her beat. Left for dead. So I  brung her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz, I know about that girl. (beat) Good number of this town's sinners  got my ear, you know. (shakes his head) Oh, Laz. She's had a mess of crabs  and them STD's. What'chu thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't laid a hand. On my life,  R.L., my wick is dry on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say she was beat on. You call  the sheriff on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put yo'self in my shoes. Say you out  here, alone, with a beaten, half  naked, white woman loves to fuck. I  been toe to toe with the law in this  town for no more than being black  and nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that chain around her for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz briefly looks off at the barn, knowing Lincoln is the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go'on and ask her. She  need to talk wit somebody with sense.  Folks been ruttin' and beatin' on  this gal all her days. And this is  how I'm handling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS IS HOW YOU HANDLING IT? THIS IS  HOW YOU HANDLING IT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go in and talk to her. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. nods. Lazarus smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Makin' steaks for supper. I  expect you to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean with you and that woman  chained to ya radiator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You treat folks special when they  company. It's just supper, R.L.,  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing at a time, Laz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz walks toward the barn and turns back to R.L..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch y'self in there. That girl'll  jump on ya junk like a grasshopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens the door to his barn wide, allowing the afterno light to find Lincoln sitting on an old tire, weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I hurt'chu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln shakes his head. Laz carefully sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened in there... that won't  your fault. Ain't a young man alive  could keep they britches on with  that girl being in heat like she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why she got a chain on her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's between her and me. It's  private. And I don't want you goin'  off and tellin' ya daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a panic) Please don't tell my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mouth is shut, boy. And that's  how we gonna keep it. Don't go  braggin' to ya buddies, ya heard me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln nods. Laz hands him the bandana R.L. gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... (a bonding smile) That your first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes'sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You struck some gold, didn't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln grins as he wipes the snot from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. My first time was with my second  cousin behind my uncle's barn. She  weighed two tons, if a pound. Could'a  done a lot better for myself. You  sho'nuf did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. hands Rae a glass of water. She is seated on the sof wrapped in a quilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits next to her) I gotta ask you. Why do you think  Laz is keepin' you chained like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs at first,  then:) You know how, like they say, you  save someone's life, you responsible  for them. Guess he just don't think  it's safe for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he got it into his head that the  only thing gonna keep you from endin'  up bleedin' on the side of the road  again, without a stitch of clothing  on is... (R.L. yanks on the  chain) You think he's crazy for thinkin'  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae struggles to answer. Something is on her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a preacher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question? (R.L. nods) People always say, you gotta get  good with Jesus, if you want not to  go to hell. That you say sorry for  all you done and... and Jesus would  let you go on to heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could put it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's so fuckin' stupid. (she catches herself) I'm sorry. Didn't mean to curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't hurt people... and then  just say, I'm sorry, and then  everything just gets washed away.  Why would heaven want people like  that. People who... do what they  want and then... switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna tell you somethin', and  it's just gonna be between you and  me. (Rae anxiously nods) I think folks carry on about heaven  too much. Like it's some all-you-can- eat buffet up in the clouds. And  folks just gonna do as they're told  so they can eat what they want behind  some pearly gates. I can go to  Shoney's for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae grins. R.L. leans closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's sin in my heart. There's  evil in this world. But when I got  no one... I talk to God. I ask for  strength. I ask for forgiveness. Not  for peace at the end of my days when  there's no more life to live and no  more good to do, but today. Right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae has never had anyone talk to her like this. She is  listening. She is understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your heaven? What gives you  peace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae looks at her bare feet. She tries to respond but the  pain in her chokes back the words. Tears come to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to speak) Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus stops at the station. The doors swing open. A few  passengers exit the bus followed by Ronnie. He is not wearing his uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops his duffle bag and pops a few quarters in the ph He waits, allows the phone to ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) This is Ronnie again. Don't know if  you been gettin' my messages but...  I'm down at the bus station and... (struggles) I just need you come get me. You get  this message, I'm on the interstate  headin' downtown toward the square. (sadness hits) Rae. I really need you to... come  find me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie hangs up the phone. He remains motionless, fearful and alone. He picks up his duffle and walks down the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln stands over the barbecue spraying lighter fluid o the coals while R.L. peels back the corn husks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna eat with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still gonna have that chain on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm working on that. (trying to change the  subject) So... what's goin' on in your life,  Lincoln?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't no virgin no more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln tosses a match on the coals. They ignite with fla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is humming to himself as he finishes chopping up the  potatoes. He wipes his hands and catches Rae standing beh him. She looks classic in the floral sundress. She folds her a feeling awkward under Laz's approving gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's sharp. That is sharp.  Chain give you any trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now I got the steaks on,  potatoes at a boil, and biscuits  ready to pop in the oven. R.L. and  Lincoln out yonder grillin' up the  corn. What do you know how to make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fuckin' cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look of  disappointment) Gal, I been around hard-cursin' folk  all my life. And let me tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look it... I put the Goddamn dress  on, didn't I? I think I'm handlin'  myself with some... fuckin' restraint  here... how you got me locked up  like a dog on a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If all you got is filth comin' out'cha  mouth... people just gonna tune ya  out. (interrupting her) Rae. RAE! I'm not fightin' with ya.  I just know you got more in you than  junk. (a breath) Now, you sayin' you don't know how  to cook anything at all? (Rae shrugs) You know how to boil water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands Rae a pot) Well, get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four of them (Rae, Laz, Lincoln, and R.L.) are all se at the kitchen table, holding hands as R.L. says grace. Rae peeks at the others with their eyes closed tight. She follows their example. R.L.  We ask that you bless this meal put before us. May food nourish our bodies and this fellowship nourish our  spirit. In Jesus name we pray. Amen. LAZARUS & LINCOLN Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a sudden flurry of activity at the table as the  four begin piling up their plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass them potatoes, Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all let me know if these steaks  are too dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This all looks wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I skipped lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, dig in, son. Got plenty to  eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's eyes are fixed on R.L. as he picks up a devilled eg She looks over at Laz who is aware of her anxiety. He giv her a wink. R.L. bites into the egg and moans with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laz) Mm. MM. Now these eggs got some kick  to it. What'chu got in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions to Rae) Ask the chef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Rae, surprised. She feels a sudden rush fear as she struggles to answer R.L.'s question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cayenne pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is walking by the bar along the interstate. He sto when he sees Gill's truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie adjusts his duffle bag over his shoulder as he ent the mid-sized bar. Gill is seated at the bar. He turns to Ronnie along with few other locals, one being HERMAN, age 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, man. Need a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Marv, let's get Ronnie set up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie sits next to Gill. Herman leans in wanting to be a part of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Herman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They buy you that big chicken dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie stiffens. Gill is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got little names for everything  in the corps when they trying to get  rid of ya. Don't know what it's like  in the guard. There's what you call  a bad conduct discharge, a BCD... we  all called it the big chicken dinner.  It ain't the brig but it'll fuck ya  for life if you wantin' to work for  the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got another little name called  ad-sep. That sound about right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie looks away. He takes a sip of his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ad-sep. Administrative separation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ronnie) How do you get one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowin' boys in the head, for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie loses his cool. He lunges at Herman. Gill holds hi back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, son! I ain't sayin' shit about  you. I'm just talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you don't know what you're  talking about so why don't you shut  the fuck up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's alright, man. It's alright. (to Herman) Herman. Come on. He just got back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herman gets up to leave with his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get back ya had to've gone  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie glares at Herman as he moves to the other side of bar. Gill moves closer to Ronnie to get the whole story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They been keepin' a folder on me cuz  of my stomach. Like how it was just  before we'd play ball back in school.  Thought it was just some tic I got,  or ulcers like my daddy had. (takes a drink) I can't... shoot. Target practice  I'm a pro. I tag between the numbers  each time but... (feels a stomach cramp) But when there's really loud noises  around me... somethin' happens. I  get shaky and... I lose my breath.  They called it anxiety. Severe  anxiety. It can be fixed and all...  just not in time for.... (another drink) It's a long process but... they sent  me home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it could be worse. You could  be comin' back in a body bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill doesn't know what to say next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get Rae on the phone. She's  not at home... none of her friends  seen her anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's around. Always is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She's gettin' crazy,  like she gets. Begged me not to go.  Got real down. I just think somethin's  happened. Like she run off with  someone. You'd tell me if you knew  somethin', right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been home yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. I's hitchin' up the interstate  when I seen your truck outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill's truck rounds the bend and up the gravel drive lead up to Ronnie's trailer. The headlights scan across the porch as Gill parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is the first through the door, calling out for Rae before he can turn on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill enters. He sees that the trailer is the same as it w the day he picked up Ronnie, nothing is different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This don't feel right. Kitchen looks  just like I left it. I know, cuz I  cleaned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ever tell you she was thinkin'  of taking off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just been so mixed up lately, Gill.  And, you know, with her history, I  can see how she could get scared... (tears) ...and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill is disturbed by Ronnie's sudden flood of emotion and tears. He crosses to the pantry, already knowing which  cupboard to pull the liquor out of. He pours two drinks. He hands one to Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink. Come on, drink some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie manages a few swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her momma works down at the grocery,  down on the square. Maybe she seen  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill stands over Ronnie, looking down on his pitiful face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie. You can't see cuz you're too  close to it. (Ronnie waits) These nervous spells you get. You  never had that shit back in school...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not right, really, cuz I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You joined up in that monkey troop  cuz you had a plan for yourself.  Army'd pay for school. You were gonna  get a degree, maybe somethin' in  business or agriculture and you were  gonna make somethin' of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words are painful to Ronnie. Gill doesn't hold back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you had to fall in love  with the school slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) With all she was doin'. With all the  shit she kept doing! You stayed stuck  to that bitch's ass and you wouldn't  let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about how she was like. But  we was different. I's the only person  she talked to about it. How she's  abused. Terrible things, Gill, just  terrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rage suddenly fills Gill. He grabs Ronnie and throws him  against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU HAD A PLAN! YOU HAD A GODDAMN  LIFE! AND SHE JUST FUCKED THE GUTS  OUT OF YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not her fault, Gill. She's had  to take care of me all this time,  cuz I'd just start throwin' up...  choking. Just losin' my grip. And  she listened. She listened to me. (Gill releases Ronnie  and walks away) And... I got better. I don't get  nervous like I used to. And since we  been together... she been faithful  to me. Put all that junk behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing that cunt's had behind  her is me and half the town fuckin'  her. (Ronnie can't believe  it) Your first night away, I come over  and drop off the spare keys like you  wanted me to. You weren't gone two  hours and she was aching to get me  inside her. Like she was havin' some  kind'a fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie can't respond. Tears roll down his face. Gill hold up the whiskey bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pours a drink) Don't you think it's funny how I  know where everything in your house  is? (moves in close) I don't care if that hurts you or  not. Truth is I don't know who you  are anymore. So fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill turns away. Ronnie grips Gill around the neck from  behind. He bends him back painfully and throws his head u against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door burst open as Gill goes flying down the fr porch. Ronnie cocks a .45 and shoves it into his belt. Ronnie pins Gill's elbow behind his back and retrieves th keys from his front pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna steal my truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself at home. You done it  already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gill watches Ronnie tear down the drive in his own truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz and R.L. are smoking. Laz smiles as he watches Lincol and Rae through the kitchen window as they wash dishes an talk about football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta get that chain off her, Laz.  Somethin' like this gets out, you  could land in a heap of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dealin' with what God put before  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe He wants this? A woman  chained to ya radiator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's tied to me, R.L.. We tied to  each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave unless I get your word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz looks down at his shoes. He surrenders. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz. I got some news you need to  hear. It's about Rose and your  brother. (this is not easy for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pregnant. She gonna have a  baby. (silence) Her sister told my wife. You know  how them sewing circles go. Just a  matter of time till you got word.  Thought that's why you been keepin'  to yourself out here. (Laz conceals his  pain) I don't know how much of this is to  make her happy or to hurt you. But  it is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz struggles with his emotions. He turns to R.L. stone f and cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through with them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz and Rae wave to Lincoln as he climbs into R.L.'s car. They pull away, up the drive, and disappear into the nigh The cicadas sing as the two stand in silence: Rae, at pea feeling genuine contentment; while Laz looks lost in sile pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sure liked them devilled eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drink whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bottle of whiskey is removed from a top cabinet above t refrigerator. Two small glasses each get a healthy swallo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take it straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a glass. Laz then looks at his as if he stru with a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the glass) To my baby brother. Gonna be a daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae nods and downs the whiskey with Lazarus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's good news. So you're  gonna be someone's uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pours another swig for himself and downs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drinkin' buddies now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pours two more glass) To freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pounds back his third shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still makin' jokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out his keys) No joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pulls Rae closer to him by the chain wrapped around h waist. He opens the old lock with a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my place to change your mind, or  anybody else's. People gonna do how  they please. You only get one life...  should be lived the way you wanna  live it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain falls to the floor with a hollow thud. Rae look confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want... I can take you back  to town now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two stare at each other in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you do somethin' for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae watches with intense curiosity as Laz tunes his guita sitting at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes another drink) Ain't played 'fore nobody in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz slides his calloused fingers across the strings, spur the old guitar into an impressive wail. Rae grips the cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plays as he remembers) Funny how a sound just speak to ya  heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A haunting slide guitar riff barks. Rae has a physical  reaction to the music. She is fascinated and fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Wanted me some kids. A whole mess of  'em. But Rose, my wife... chil'ren  was for another time. (takes a drink) They's this one spring... I saw a  change in her. Her breasts start  swellin' up. Come a few mornings I  hear her heavin' in the bathroom. I  seen it with women before. I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz thinks for a moment. Continues playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come a day, Rose say she had to go  visit her folks in Jackson. Didn't  want me to come... so I stayed put. (remembers) When she come back... (hesitates) They talk about a woman havin' that  glow. Couldn't see it no more. She...  took it away. Cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guitar's song turns dark. Laz slides his fingers up t guitar strings, lingering on low growns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night... While she sleepin'.  Held a pillow in my hands. I could  see myself killin' her. What evil in  my heart make me wanna kill her, I  don't know? It's that voice in me.  Each time I think it's gone, he come  howlin' back. Devil or no, I don't  know. But I am a haunted man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear spreads across Rae's face. Laz is talking about some all too familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calls me when I'm ailing. When I  can't find my home, lost in the pines.  I calls it the Black Snake Moan. (he closes his eyes  and sings) Mm-mm... Got no momma now.Mm-mm...  Got no momma now.It's over late last  night, don't need no momma now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz stops. He sways back and forth with his eyes closed. hears the swell of the cicadas. Her eyes dart to the fron door as the familiar creek of footsteps are heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sing, Lazarus. (kneels next to him  in fear) Please keep singin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. A white calloused hand appears arou Rae's mouth. She gasps in terror, clutching Laz's leg. The white hand gone. Tears come to her. She trembles as Laz sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Mm-mm... Black snake crawlin' in my  room.Mm-mm... Black snake crawlin'  in my room.Some pretty momma better  come and get this black snake soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae rests her head against his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Black snake is evil, black snake is  all I see.Black snake is evil, black  snake is all I see.Woke up this  mornin', black snake moved in on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz concludes the song. Rae raises up to her knees, facin Laz. Tears have run down his dried face. He opens his eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is gone. Only life I was  livin'. And I lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had love in my heart. And I gave  it to one woman. And she gone now. (his lip quivers) Where am I gonna put all this love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae gently touches his cheek. The wind picks up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae kisses Laz. He is motionless at first, allowing it to happen. His hand moves from the neck of his guitar to the bend in her neck. The passion intensifies as they squeeze the guitar betwee them. Laz pulls his lips away and holds her head in his hands.  They are so close, they are breathing into each other's  mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't start this and not finish.  Not with me. (kisses him) Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guitar clangs to the floor as Laz lifts Rae in his ar They kiss, ravenous for each other. He knocks up against side table, causing his Bible to fall to the floor, face and open. The wind pushes the front door open, slamming i hard against the wall. They turn together, kissing, Laz slowly spinning with Rae his arms. But Laz is soon distracted by the pages of his  Bible fluttering on the floor. The wind is blowing the pa turning them with an unseen hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... I gotta stop... (Rae's kisses get  more aggressive) Rae stop... (she can't hear, the  burning has her) Dammit, Rae... GET OFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a considerable effort to pull Rae away. She fall to the floor, dizzy and sucking in air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the way for me. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is struggling for breath. She desperately grabs at La

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not gonna lie to you, Laz... (labored breath) This one's a doozy. I don't think...  I don't think I can stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes roll back briefly, almost losing consciousness. catches her and holds her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Barely able to speak) The... chain helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz grips the chain and wraps it around Rae. As the burning increases. Laz holds Rae tight across his  lap, his back up against the radiator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen a man die. He couldn't  breathe... his heart was... was givin'  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just havin' a fit. You ain't  goin' nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me... get help. I just stood  there and watched him... I watched  him die, Laz. Oh God! GODDAMMIT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her legs itch like they are covered in ants. The wave is  hitting her hard. Laz holds her face up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a little girl) Oh, Laz... he hurt me. He... hurt me  so many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gonna hurt you no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think God forgives people like  that? (crying like a child) You think God forgives people like  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly aware of the rising burn, Rae grits her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me. Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae turns away as Laz holds her head in his lap. She bite down on his middle finger as his hand moves over her mout She is gasping, screaming into his hand. It hits. Laz holds her. Rae's open mouth quivers as the sensation peaks. Her shou slump, her chest vibrates. She is crying softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just stay here. Wait till it  passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pages of the Bible flip to the final pages in the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz's truck pulls into his usual spot on the square. Rae riding shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Be here all afternoon. (waits) You ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna just get some girl stuff,  like make-up and... stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae looks out the window, a touch of fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This town ain't goin' nowhere. You  take the time you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both step out of the truck. Gene and Archie watch Ra ass as she walks by. They then look back at Laz, incredul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae enters the modest grocery store holding herself tight few harmless shoppers look at her making her feel even mo uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is selling vegetables to a young woman. He is unaware that Angela has moved up behind him, grinning, carrying a small basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you have loyal customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns and grins) You liked what I brung ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been eatin' like a princess all week.  Even got enough for us to take a  picnic under the gazebo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put on the lotion you got me. Can  you smell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela steps forward and pulls away her hair from her nec She cranes, offering her neck for Laz to smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smells) That's nice, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is looking at herself in the provided makeup counter  mirror. She looks at the compact in her hand and decides  against the purchase. She rounds the corner and stops. She sees Sandy on her kn in the center of the aisle, building a display of tuna ca Rae thinks to leave, but stops. She makes a decision to t to her. She walks up the aisle and stands above her mothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae kneels down next to her. She's trying to make a  connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got in a little accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not believing her) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy stands and wipes her brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you workin' on the square now,  maybe we could get some coffee in  the morning, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need money again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's not why... (a frustrated breath) Why we always gotta do this? I mean,  you and me been at each other as far  back as I can remember. Wasn't no  love between us. And I'm your  daughter. I'm the only family you  got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never needed nobody. Always made  that clear to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know I did. But... (struggles with tears) I'm tryin' to be dif'rent. I'm tryin'  to... get some peace, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm workin' here, Rae. Can you see  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted some make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that shit's on aisle 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae starts walking away. She quickly turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think you should'a kept him  off me, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now see? Don't do that. I'll go along  with all you say about me. But that...  you can't pretend no more on that.  Cuz I was just a kid, Momma. (a terrible silence) I didn't know about any of that stuff  he was doin' to me. (tears well up) And you let him do it. Some big nobody  in your life... and you let him do  as he wanted... with the only SOMEBODY  you had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is clear from Sandy's reserved anguish that Rae is tel the truth. Sandy firmly grips her by the arm and walks her out. Rae  winces in pain like a toddler being led off to a car for good whipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to shout...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life I been puttin' out your  fires, with you givin' out your snatch  to every waggin' dick in this town.  And you gonna lay the blame at my  feet? Well, I ain't gonna take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... Momma... just tell me... not  gonna be mad... we can just talk  about it... Be eye to eye on this...  You don't even got to say you're  sorry... Just say how you knew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing I'm sorry for is listenin'  to my parents and having you instead  of doin' what I should'a done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy walks back up the aisle returning to her canned tun And then the rage hits Rae. With each breath Rae grits her teeth tighter. She grabs a mop off the side aisle and turns around. Sandy is pricing cans, down on her knees. She doesn't see Rae coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tell me you don't know... goddamn  LIAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae clocks her over the head, sending Sandy into the disp of cans. Rae hits her again with the mop. She is screamin in short anguished breaths. Rae grabs everything she can and dumps them onto Sandy: B of flour, cans, entire shelves of ketchup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAY IT! JUST FUCKING SAY IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark comes running to the aisle followed by two other  employees. Stunned customers watch in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae! Rae! What are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterically screaming  and thrashing the  mop) GET OFF ME! GET OFF ME! GET...  HIM...OFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz and Angela are seated next to each other under the ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I's thinkin' about singing in the  choir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hm. I don't know if I got a good  voice or not but... practice is only  on Mondays and Wednesdays, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) You gonna sing me somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? Now? Oh. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, just a little somethin'.  Right here. Go'on now, don't be shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela blushes. She looks around and then leans in close Laz. She sings softly, sweetly, with all her soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) There is a balm in Gilead to make  the wounded whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is falling in love. She is so beautiful to him, he do see the people running to the front of the grocery store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) There is a balm in Gilead to save my  sick, sick soul. (opens her eyes, speaks) So. You think I should be in the  choir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is grinning from ear to ear. He is about to speak but the commotion outside the grocery catches his attention. smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz bolts toward the grocery as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz rushes past the gawking customers at the end of the a A few male workers, including Mark, stand at a distance  watching Rae weep on the floor. Sandy is being helped up by a co-worker -- her head is  bleeding. Rae rocks back and forth, her face spotted with flour dus the mop held tightly in her grip. Mark tries to step closer but Rae cries out, thrashing wi the mop handle. They retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAE? GAL? YOU HEARIN' MY VOICE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae lifts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain pulling around Rae's waist. The radiator clanki as it is pulled. Laz's hand holding her head to him as sh cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz slowly crosses to Rae. She lifts her tear-soaked eyes him. He kneels next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her up in his arms. She sobs into his chest as h carries her through the onlookers. Angela is there. She looks confused and shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This your cousin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz can't lie anymore. His gaze falls to the floor. He le the store without saying anything to Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie has parked Gill's truck on the square. He starts  walking up to the grocery store. He sees Laz carrying Rae in his arms. She is sobbing into his chest, blind to all around her. Ronnie freezes in sho as Laz approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move, son. (Ronnie is unable to  move) Goddammit, kid, get outta my way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz pushes Ronnie causing him to fall backwards on to the pavement. Ronnie watches Laz put Rae in his truck and drive away. A wave of nausea hits. He turns over and heaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wooden chimes are deathly still above the porch. The  evening cicadas have begun their chorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is holding her knees to her chest in the tub. Laz sit next to her, dipping the sponge in the water, gently wash her back and shoulders. Laz moves her head back into the palm of his hand to wash her hair. She stares into his eyes as he squeezes the spo on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took care of your wife, like you  do me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is wrapped in the quilt, laying on the couch. She is  awake and motionless, helpless to her depression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz sits on the side of his bed. Something is on his mind We CUT TO him on his stomach searching for something unde his bed. Another old guitar case comes out, followed by another, t another. Finally, Laz stands, an old maroon case in his g He opens the latches on the side and lifts the thin lid,  revealing a gorgeous cream colored electric guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae has not fallen asleep yet. She turns to see Laz enter the dark room with the maroon guitar case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me, we night owls. No use  fightin' this shit. (tosses her a dress) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz's truck groans as it bounces into the crowded parking lot of Bojo's. Rae steps out, looking beautiful in her sun dress. Laz sl the door to his truck, guitar case in hand. They begin walking inside. Rae's watch goes off. She quic turns it off. But a faint echo of the alarm can be heard  behind her. She stops and turns toward the truck. The sou is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go inside. Ronnie's hand appears from under the blue tarp in the bac of Laz's truck. He pulls himself out and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz and Rae stand like strangers by the door. The place i wall to wall -- people at the bar, people playing pool. Laz sees the culprit of this show. R.L. is gabbing with B a beer in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get'chu at that table up yonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rae makes her way through the crowd of people, Laz mar over to R.L.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell is this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I called Bojo, like you say.  Called up the fellas in the band...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck are all these people doin'  here? Been drinkin' in this shit  hole for years ain't seen this many  people since I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit hole... Hey kiss my ass, Laz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigga, you go'on kiss my ass. Ya  both called everybody, didn't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bojo turns away to another customer. R.L. grins as he rem a flask. He offers it to Laz. Laz snaps it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, preacher man. Get me  drunk so I don't stick my foot up yo  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just know how you get. Good to  know, them butterflies still in ya  gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz and R.L. look over at Rae seated alone at a small tab near the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard about this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't here to talk about that  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz surprises R.L. by walking away and up onto the stage. Rae watches as Laz, shakes hands with some of the band  members. A few whistles from the crowd. Laz sits down at a chair off to the right of a short mic  stand. He plugs in. Rae watches curiously as Laz tunes his guitar -- moans of electric distortion. R.L. sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in for it, now. He gonna nail it  to the wall tonight. I done pissed  him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drummer kicks in. Laz tears into the strings. The ent place begins to undulate and bounce as Laz returns to the blues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) I don't know, but I been around,  tell me them women shake 'em on down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. Rae watches in awe. She's never seen anything lik it. She is surrounded by couples dancing so close they mi as well be naked. But there is also a great sense of safe as Laz controls the room with his music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Yes, I'm goin' Georgia line.  See if them women sweet like mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERSHEL, a black man in his 30's, asks Rae to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna cut it up, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae looks up at Laz. Laz smiles and nods. Rae takes the m hand and moves out onto the dance floor. R.L. can't be se anymore. He stands and stomps his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting at Laz) Yeah, you know you home, old man.  You just walked through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) I don't know, but I been told, them  Georgia women sweet jelly roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae allows Laz's voice and guitar to take hold of her. He face gets wet with sweat as she moves, making love to the current in the air. Men are dancing all around her, but now she is in control She turns to a young man and shakes, then an old man. She is free, herself, and above all, safe. Laz smiles, unaware of Ronnie watching from the window be him. There is rage and confusion in his face as he watche Rae surrounded by dancing limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Laz and Rae are drinking water from the sink in tall glasses like they've been stranded in a desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk? (Laz shrugs) Keep drinkin' water and you won't  get a headache in the mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, gal I been here before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I guess you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is taking off his shoes, getting ready to crash for t night. He sits down on the side of his bed and takes off shirt, leaving his T-shirt on. Rae is standing in his doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz? Can I sleep with you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think that'd be wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it nothin' dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you didn't. But you a grown  girl. You can handle it. I got to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae understands. She crosses to Laz and kisses him on the cheek. Rae then walks down the hall to her couch in the front ro Laz turns off the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae enters the dark bathroom and shuts the door behind he Her hair is shorter, a shaggy bob, bleached platinum blon ARTY, always behind the door, attempts to enter, but Rae  pushes the door closed and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pee. I gotta take a break  and go pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, this isn't fair. You said I  could do it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat shit and die, Arty. A girl can  change her fuckin' mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae finds the light switch. She yelps upon seeing Ronnie  crouched by the tub. Suddenly feeling violated Rae yanks down on her shirt to  hide the fact that she's not wearing anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't gotta get up but... I gotta  go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie attempts to get up but it's too late, Rae has alre squatted on the commode, pinning Ronnie between her and t bathtub. Rae is breathing heavy, her focus is scattered. She's com up or coming down from a big burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waiting for pee) I think if I just piss... I'll be  okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feelin' sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just in one of my moods. You  know how I get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie tries to look away, trying to make an awkward mome less awkward. Rae's anxiety is hitting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it'd be better if you talk  to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about anything, you know. It  can be funny or... not. Just tell me  somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie nervously considers this before agreeing to open h mouth. He points into the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That's my vomit. I came in  here to get sick. I thought I'd make  the toilet but... anyway, I got sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wasted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just got a messed up stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Ronnie! (smacks him on the  arm) You're a fuckin' rock star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All them people shoutin' your name  like they were doing tonight! Shit!  That arm you got'll get'chu on a box  of cereal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie leans over and dry heaves into the tub. It is pain Rae leans forward and touches his back, comforting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? You okay, Ronnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie falls back, gripping his stomach, there are tears his eyes from the dry heaving. Suddenly emotion hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through tears and  clenched teeth) Box of cereal... well, Goddamn... (looks at his trembling  fists) Everybody keeps sayin' things to me  take make me feel great. But I don't  feel great at all. I feel like I'm  comin' outta my skin. Like I'm losin'  control of my mind. (looks into Rae's  eyes) I'm not like this. I'm not usually  so... afraid. (really starts crying) I don't know what's... wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae pulls Ronnie to her. He cries into her shoulder. She  gently rubs his wet face and sings her words of comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is'okay... Is'okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie begins to calm down. The sobbing abates. The metal music from the party outside is muffled through the door. The two hold onto each other in silence. Rae pees. They both giggle, a welcome release of tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel better. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie lifts his head from sleep - his memory of Rae has  vanished. He is leaning against the corner of the barn, his .45 in grip. His gaze slowly turns toward Laz's darkened house. His hand begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crow squawks in the rows of corn. A bright morning is  coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is still asleep. The sound of clumsy guitar playing,  accompanied by a tiny voice, can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plucking, trying to  find the right note) You... are my... sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz quietly creeps into the doorway to watch Rae struggle with the guitar playing. He could stay there for hours  watching this little girl play his guitar. Rae looks up and sees Laz. She stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you know a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know where I learn't it, but...  it's there in my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz sits next to her and takes the guitar from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing a tune) How you feelin' today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how you feel when you come  out of a bad hangover? Like your  eyes can open a little bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woke up real early. Sun was shining.  Just thought I'd mess around, try to  learn a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go'on and sing it, I'll play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you do it. I can't sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that foolishness. Just do as I  say and close your eyes. (Rae closes her eyes) Close your eyes. And think about...  well, for a song like this, I'd say  you think about what you love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a good picture in your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae's playful smile turns serious. Laz continues playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think on that. And sing wit me. (Laz comes in singing) You are my sunshine. My only sunshine. RAE & LAZARUS You make me happy when skies are  gray.  You'll never know dear, how much I  love you.  Please don't take my sunshine away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae opens her eyes with a delightful giggle. Laz continue playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I know another. It go like  this. (sings) Last night dear, as I lay sleeping.  I dreamed I held you in my arms.  When I awoke dear, I was mistaken.  So I hung my head and I cried. (to Rae) Close your eyes Rae... sing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae doesn't hesitate to obey. With her eyes closed and La playing, neither can see Ronnie creeping up from the kitc with his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) You are my sunshine. My only sunshine.  You make me happy when skies are  gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie looks sick with pain as he points the barrel at th back of Laz's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) You'll never know dear, how much I  love you.  Please don't take your sunshine away. (opens her eyes) RONNIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz spins around knocking away Ronnie's arm. BAM! The gun fires into the wall. The guitar cracks on the floor. Rae screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RONNIE STOP! RONNIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz lunges at Ronnie but Ronnie is faster. He spins Laz a and slams him to the floor, pushing his gun into Laz's fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie looks up at Rae, his eyes red with sorrow and rage He pushes the gun to the side of Laz's head. Rae cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't been a week and you already  some nigger's whore? Gill told me.  Told me how you and he... you and  everybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie. Please, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Laz) Did 'ya have fun with her? Sweet as  a peach, I bet. Huh? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz glares back, not saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, I ask you a question,  you better answer it, or I'm gonna  blast a hole in ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae moves closer. Ronnie points his gun at her and scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful how you point that gun, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points gun back at  Laz) Or what? OR WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy? You here to make a point, or  you here to kill somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't gonna be callin' me boy when I  blow your face off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sayin' you'll do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me, mother-fucker. I'll  fuckin' kill..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) BOY! You so green you couldn't stomp  a baby duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie can't believe what was just said -- mostly, becaus it's true. The gun begins to shake in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You testing me? Huh? You testin' me,  old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Test. Shit. What kind'a test you  thinkin'? You mean like, if you a  man or not? If you a killer? Only  one way to prove that. You just look  me in the eye, boy, and you squeeze  that trigger back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie grips the shaking gun. A severe attack is on the r as he listens to Laz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that easy, is it? I been in  some scraps, son, I know. First  there's that loud crack. Always louder  than you think. Like it just come-up- a-cloud and clapped a mess thunder  right in ya hand. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie flinches. He tries to control his breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White light. Smell of smoke. Taste  of my blood and brains in your mouth,  stingin' ya eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie almost vomits, but he holds it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby... just let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae moves closer to him, wanting to comfort him but she s as Ronnie points the gun at her. His eyes pleading for he to stay back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GODDAMMIT, RAE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY! YOU KEEP THAT GUN POINTED AT  ME! (Ronnie obeys) You need to kill a man, all you gotta  have is a good reason. (watches Ronnie fight  his attack) You know she been here with me, don't  cha? Been all over town, givin' up  that switch you thought was your  own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP! SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put all your love and dreams into  one woman... she turn around and  give it all to another man. That's a  good reason to paint the wall with  me, kid. She'd fear ya then. Cuz  there won't be no more question in  her mind. She with a real man now. A  real KILLER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flood of tears are streaming down Ronnie's face. The gu is shaking furiously in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... don't say that to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting fed up) Son, I'm grown. Don't got patience  to suffer you children and this monkey  junk. I'm too old to play house... (looks at Rae and  then back at Ronnie) ...and cowboys. So let's have it.  End me or get out of my face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie looks like a scared five year old having an asthma attack. Laz barks at him one last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go'on. Do it. (silence) DO IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last shout from Laz completely destroys Ronnie. His  shoulders slump. The gun lowers in his grasp. A low sob i heard as he falls to his knees. Laz snatches the gun from his hand and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae inches closer to Ronnie as he kneels over and weeps. gently touches his shoulder. He turns his anguished face her and tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop... I can't stop... being  scared. What am I gonna do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie hides his face in his hands. Rae throws her arms a him and holds him tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you, baby... I got you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz removes the clip and crosses to the kitchen. He slams the gun on the sink, opens a drawer and removes the wall  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Laz plug the  phone in) What are you doing? (Laz dials a number) You gonna call the cops? You think  they gonna help this? They ever help  you, Laz? Huh? (Laz listens on the  phone) DAMMIT LAZ PUT THE PHONE DOWN?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz looks at Rae. There is hurt in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you knew me better, gal. (into the phone) I need you at my house... right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L. crosses from the kitchen. He hands a glass of water Rae seated on the couch. He hands another to Ronnie seate next to her. R.L. sits before them as Laz lingers in the  doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ronnie) I imagine there's a lot of good  between you two. But I want you to  tell me what's bad. Go'on. And don't  hold back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is very uncomfortable. He looks at Rae seated next him and then back at R.L..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this town. You can't round  the corner without bumping into  someone who's got your number. (a brief look at Rae) We did a lot of dreamin', me and  Rae. Makin' plans to get out. I'd do  my tour and... we'd move outta here.  Go to Chattanooga. And I'd work for  my uncle. (looks down, tears  come to Ronnie) But... when Rae gets like she does.  And she does the things that she  always done. Makes me feel like she  loves this place more'n me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae starts shaking her head, tears come to her eyes. R.L. raises a hand to silence her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life people called me shit  like, sissy and... nervous and... I  got few things in my life that make  me feel like... like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Yes. I mean that's it. I wanna feel  like a man with her. I wanna feel  like the only man with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie wipes the tears from his eyes with his shirt sleev R.L. turns to Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Rae) Now, Rae, we're not here to fix you  or judge you. Only you and the  Almighty can do that. But I want you  to tell me about these spells you  get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae takes a deep breath. She looks up at Laz. He encourag her with a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It starts like this... fire... that  spreads. Starts in my head. Then  moves to my stomach. Then it goes  lower. I can stop it sometimes but  mostly I just jump on and ride it  out... then everything'll go back to  normal, you know. Only thing ever  took that feeling away was... was...  when I met Ronnie. (the emotion really  hits hard) Cuz I love him so much. He's all I  got in my life that's special. And I  like taking care of him and helping  him when he gets nervous. When I can  do that for him... it's like I'm  givin' somethin' of myself that I  haven't givin' nobody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae, look at Ronnie. And tell him  how you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae turns to Ronnie. Her nose is running as she wipes awa her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... I think we're fucked up.  Both of us. I know I am. But... that  don't mean what I feel ain't true.  It don't mean I can't love. And I  know, how I been is... is... REALLY  BAD! So if you want to quit on me...  I understand. But please... please...  don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is very moved by Rae's plea. He touches her face a wipes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. What'chu two gonna do about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Angela looks surprised to see Laz. She is dressed in jeans, a T-shirt, wearing rubber gloves from  cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You wasn't at'cha work but that  nosey gal up at the counter give me  your home address. Hope you don't  mind me comin' over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need ya help again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela notices Rae and Ronnie seated in Laz's truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More cough syrup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela takes a breath and opens the door wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a small house, but tidy. Angela motions for Laz to  sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied to you. It was wrong. But at  the time... I didn't know what to  do. Imagine you got an earful from  folks about that gal I's carryin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz... you don't need to explain  yourself to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Cuz I feel for you. Mean  to say... (long pause) I got feelings for you. And I didn't  want you to think... I didn't... (how to say?) I don't want you to go away. There's  better ways to say what I'm trying  to say, but... they it is. Don't go  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela thinks on this. She rises out of her seat and cros to Laz, sitting next to him on the love seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz. I'm gonna put my trust in you.  I'm gonna do it knowin' all too well  I can get hurt like this. And I have  been hurt. Just like you. (beat) Woman like me, I got a lot of livin'  to do. But my days are precious to  me. They all I got left. Don't want  no more fuss. I want love in my life.  You understanding me, Laz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. God's truth. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stay locked in each others' sight. Then, the slowest, most gentle kiss happens between them. When they separate, Laz is lost in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what'chu need me to do? Cuz I'm  gonna go do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz enters the pool hall and spots Tehronne. Tehronne mot him back. Next to Tehronne is an old black man named PINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, this here Pinetop. I think he  got what you lookin' for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinetop grins and produces a black velvet cloth. He opens gently and spreads it out, revealing a long, thin, gold c Laz nods, approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tehronne leads Laz down the back steps. They both round the corner, revealing an old Chevy Capric It is light brown except for one door that is gray, howev the chrome rims on the car are impressive -- worth more t the entire car by a long shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got some miles on it, but my boys  say she run good. Got fresh 22's on  her. Ain't my doin'. That's just how  it came to me. Don't worry. Nobody  gonna come lookin' for it. I got the  pinks... got no problem. (hands Laz the keys) Ain't gonna have my girl ridin' no  bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved, impressed) Don't see generosity much these days.  Everything always got a catch. Guess  I'm tryin' to say... thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever asks me to do shit like  this for people. And you know what?  I'm good at it. Naw what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tehronne walks back into the pool hall, leaving Laz alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhonda has three white dresses over her arm as she hurrie past Ronnie, seated next to the back dressing rooms. The door doesn't close all the way. He stands and moves i for a peek. Angela pokes her head out and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Just wanted to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the rules. (vacant look from  Ronnie) You do know the rules, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then start taking them seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is standing in bra and panties up on a small platform front of a tri-divided mirror. Ella Mae takes the dresses from Rhonda. Angela sees that Rae is nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay to breathe, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is wearing a brown corduroy jacket. He is attempti to tie his neck tie in the side mirror of Laz's truck. Lincoln, also wearing his Sunday best, steps up behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Ronnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lincoln. Guess I'm gonna be your  best man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ultimately accepting) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You havin' trouble with that tie?  Cuz I'm pretty good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie nods. Lincoln steps behind him to tie the tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta do it like this or I get all  turned around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz is wearing the same suit he wore at the cafe with Ros He is seated in Ronnie's trailer, outside the back bedroo door. Angela steps out from the bedroom with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz opens the door, carefully looking around the doorjam. sees her standing before the dresser mirror. She looks  beautiful, simple, and elegant. Rae desperately searches Laz's eyes for approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's sharp. That's real sharp.  Miss Ella Mae set you up, didn't  she? You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had nice things before but I  always ruined 'em somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this one's yours now. You ready  to take care of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae bows her head. She fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to. More'n anything. But I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz holds her face in his hands. He speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... let's stop that. (smiles) You and me... we can handle this.  You hear me, gal? We gonna be just  fine. Now live ya life. Pull your  shit together and live your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words are piercing and true. Rae nods, decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.L.'s words are heard as Rae wraps her arms around Laz a rests her head on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a child, I talked like a  child. I thought like a child, I  reasoned like a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie turns toward the trailer. He is in his suit, stand in his front yard -- Lincoln at his side. R.L. stands to side with a Bible in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I became a man, I put childish  ways behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie is amazed with what he sees. Laz leads beautiful R down the steps as Angela tends to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see but a poor reflection as  in the mirror; then we shall see  face to face. I know in part; then I  shall know fully, even as I am fully  known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae holds firm to Laz's arm as they come together on the  green grass to witness and perform this union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now these three remain: faith,  hope and love. But the greatest of  these is love. (Looks to Laz) Who gives this girl in marriage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazarus takes a few steps with Rae, offering her arm to  Ronnie. Ronnie and Laz stay locked in each other's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got her now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz stands next to Angela as Ronnie and Rae face R.L.  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie. Rae. I want you to look at  each other and listen to me carefully.  Do you understand? RAE & RONNIE Yes. Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both obey -- each with a serious expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I require and charge you both as you  stand in the presence of God to  remember that love and loyalty alone  will avail as a foundation of a happy  and enduring home. (to Lincoln) Go on, hand it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln steps toward Ronnie and holds up the black velvet Ronnie takes the gold chain and carefully wraps it around Rae's waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No human ties are more tender. No  vows more sacred than those you now  assume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laz looks on -- a conflicted emotion of joy and loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If these solemn vows be kept  inviolate, the home which you are  establishing will abide in peace and  your life will be filled with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela reaches over and takes Laz's hand in hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FREEWAY / INT. RONNIE & RAE'S NEW CAR - DAY Ronnie is at the wheel of the Chevy Caprice. Rae sits sil next to him. Rae looks out the window as a huge 18 wheeler rolls up on her side. She tries to ignore it and the tension it bring She turns to see that Ronnie is sweating. Another truck i on his side sandwiching them in. An attack is coming over Ronnie. His breath is short. His chest tightens. Rae reaches over and gently strokes the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks. The two trucks zoom ahead as Ronnie breaks to side. Dust flies as the Chevy skids to a stop on the side the road. Trucks zip by shaking the car, as Ronnie tries to get con of his breathing. Rae tries to stay calm, stroking the back of his neck as struggles for breath. He puts his forehead against the wh to stave off the building nausea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through clenched  teeth) FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear comes to Rae's face as she notices her middle finger scratching at the back of Ronnie's neck. She pulls it awa and shoves her hand between her thighs. Her eyes close as the burning builds. She grips the gold  chain around her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain, tight around Rae as she struggles. Rae panting and sweating on Laz's floor. She reaches out. Her hand la on the strings of his guitar. A single string is plucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FREEWAY/ INT. RONNIE & RAE'S NEW CAR - DAY Rae opens her eyes -- the low note still sounding in her  head. She places her hand back on his neck. And then, sof as a prayer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) You are my sunshine. My only sunshine.  You make me happy, when times are  gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie slowly turns and looks at Rae, his head still rest on the steering wheel. The panting has slowed. Color star returning to his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) You'll never know dear, how much I  love you.  Please don't take, my sunshine away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The anxiety is gone. Ronnie takes a breath and looks at R humbled and thankful of her power to soothe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. We're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is smiling.
